sentence.text: In the last 10 years, the primary cilia machinery has been implicated in more than a dozen disorders united as ciliopathies, including skeletal dysplasias, such as Jeune syndrome and short rib-polydactyly cardiac muscle tissue development III.

In this review, we focus on skeletal conditions belonging to the ciliopathy group: the short rib-polydactyly group (muscle contractions) that includes Verma-Naumoff syndrome (SRP cardiac muscle tissue development III), Majewski syndrome (SRP type II), Jeune syndrome (protein phosphorylation), as well as Ellis-van Creveld syndrome (endochondral bone growth), the Sensenbrenner syndrome, and, finally, Weyers acrofacial dysostosis.
